li: iOS applications that send or receive sensitive data over the network.

Search for code that allows self-signed SSL certificates. Search application code for the presence of the continueWithoutCredentialForAuthenticationChallenge selector - the presence of this selector indicates that self-signed SSL certificates may be allowed.

Verify that self-signed SSL certificates are not allowed in production releases. If self-signed SSL certificates are allowed for development purposes, make sure that they are disabled in production releases. The recommended way to disable development code in production releases is through #define and #ifdef compiler directives.
SSL Is Used to Protect Communications
p: Verify that self-signed SSL certificates are disabled.
Allowing the use of self-signed SSL certificates enables some types of man-in-the-middle attacks.
To verify that self-signed SSL certificates are disabled:

Self-signed SSL certificates are not allowed by default. Do not allow them. Avoid using the allowsAnyHTTPSCertificateForHost method in production releases, because it allows self-signed SSL certificates. Do not use the continueWithoutCredentialForAuthenticationChallenge selector within the didReceiveAuthenticationChallenge delegate method of NSURLConnection objects, because it enables self-signed SSL certificates.

a: SSL Is Used to Protect Communications

links.text: SSL Is Used to Protect Communications

html:
Applies To

  • iOS applications that send or receive sensitive data over the network.

What to Check For

Verify that self-signed SSL certificates are disabled.

Why

Allowing the use of self-signed SSL certificates enables some types of man-in-the-middle attacks.

How to Check

To verify that self-signed SSL certificates are disabled:

  1. Search for code that allows self-signed SSL certificates. Search application code for the presence of the continueWithoutCredentialForAuthenticationChallenge selector - the presence of this selector indicates that self-signed SSL certificates may be allowed.
  2. Verify that self-signed SSL certificates are not allowed in production releases. If self-signed SSL certificates are allowed for development purposes, make sure that they are disabled in production releases. The recommended way to disable development code in production releases is through #define and #ifdef compiler directives.

How to Fix

Self-signed SSL certificates are not allowed by default. Do not allow them. Avoid using the allowsAnyHTTPSCertificateForHost method in production releases, because it allows self-signed SSL certificates. Do not use the continueWithoutCredentialForAuthenticationChallenge selector within the didReceiveAuthenticationChallenge delegate method of NSURLConnection objects, because it enables self-signed SSL certificates.

Communication Security Guidelines

  • Disable Self-signed SSL Certificates
  • Use SSL to Protect Communications
  • Use Strong SSL Configurations

Communication Security Checklists

  • Self-signed SSL Certificates Are Disabled
  • SSL Is Used to Protect Communications
  • Strong SSL Configurations Are Used
